Kenneth Stanley wrote:

>John, here are my thoughts:
>
>Second, as much as possible, I would try to give the same random
>sample to different networks in the same generation.  The problem is
>that you are going to come up against considerable noise if you start
>taking different random samples.  Of course, in the limit evolution
>can theoretically sort through that noise, but in practice a great
>deal of noise can be insurmountable.  
>
>  
>
Definitely agree with this. If you don't compare against a stable set of 
samples then some genomes will receive a good evaluation by chance (and 
visa versa). This then will send the search down misleading avenues thus 
decreasing the efficiency of the search, which is precisely what you're 
trying to avoid!

Colin.
